addAllowedBaseAsset(address).custom:emits: BaseAssetAdded event with the asset address and admin
addAllowedBaseAsset(address).custom:error-cases: - ZeroAddress: When baseAsset is the zero address
addAllowedBaseAsset(address).custom:requirements: - Caller must have DEFAULT_ADMIN_ROLE   - baseAsset must be a valid address (non-zero)   - baseAsset must not already be in the allowlist
addAllowedBaseAsset(address).custom:state-changes: - Adds baseAsset to the allowedBaseAssets EnumerableSet
addAllowedBaseAsset(address).details: Allows the specified base asset to be used for creating new markets.      Only assets that have been tested and verified should be added to ensure protocol security.

params.baseAsset: Address of the base asset to add to the allowlist

cancelUpgrade().details: Only callable by addresses with LendefiConstants.UPGRADER_ROLE

createMarket(address,string,string).custom:emits: MarketCreated event with all deployed contract addresses
createMarket(address,string,string).custom:error-cases: - ZeroAddress: When baseAsset is the zero address   - MarketAlreadyExists: When market for this caller/asset pair already exists   - CloneDeploymentFailed: When any contract clone deployment fails
createMarket(address,string,string).custom:requirements: - baseAsset must be a valid ERC20 token address (non-zero)   - Market for this caller/baseAsset pair must not already exist   - Implementation contracts must be set before calling this function   - Caller must have MARKET_OWNER_ROLE
createMarket(address,string,string).custom:state-changes: - Creates new market entry in nested markets mapping   - Adds baseAsset to ownerBaseAssets mapping for the caller   - Adds caller to allMarketOwners array (if first market)   - Adds market info to allMarkets array   - Deploys multiple new contract instances
createMarket(address,string,string).details: Deploys a complete lending market infrastructure including:      1. LendefiCore contract (cloned from implementation)      2. LendefiMarketVault contract (cloned from implementation)      3. Proof of Reserves feed (cloned from implementation)      4. Proper initialization and cross-contract linking      Each market owner can create their own isolated lending markets where each base asset      operates independently with its own liquidity pools and risk parameters.      The caller (msg.sender) becomes the market owner.

params.baseAsset: The ERC20 token address that will serve as the base asset for lending
params.name: The name for the ERC4626 yield token (e.g., "Lendefi USDC Yield Token")
params.symbol: The symbol for the ERC4626 yield token (e.g., "lendUSDC")

getAllActiveMarkets().custom:gas-considerations: This function iterates through all owners and markets,                            which can be gas-intensive with many markets
getAllActiveMarkets().details: Filters through all created markets and returns only those marked as active.

returns._0: Array containing Market structs of all active markets

getAllowedBaseAssets().custom:gas-considerations: May be expensive for large allowlists; consider pagination for UI
getAllowedBaseAssets().details: Retrieves the complete list of base assets that can be used for market creation.      This function is useful for UI applications to display available options.

returns._0: Array of all allowed base asset addresses

getAllowedBaseAssetsCount().custom:gas-efficient: Constant time operation regardless of allowlist size
getAllowedBaseAssetsCount().details: Provides the count of assets in the allowlist without returning the full array.      Useful for pagination and gas-efficient checks.

returns._0: The count of allowed base assets

getMarketInfo(address,address).custom:error-cases: - ZeroAddress: When marketOwner or baseAsset is the zero address   - MarketNotFound: When no market exists for the specified owner/asset pair
getMarketInfo(address,address).custom:requirements: - marketOwner must be a valid address (non-zero)   - baseAsset must be a valid address (non-zero)   - Market for the specified marketOwner/baseAsset pair must exist
getMarketInfo(address,address).details: Returns the full Market struct containing all deployed contract addresses      and configuration data for the specified market.

params.baseAsset: Address of the base asset to query market information for

returns._0: Market configuration struct containing all market data

getMarketOwnerByIndex(uint256).custom:requirements: - index must be less than allMarketOwners.length
getMarketOwnerByIndex(uint256).details: Retrieves an owner address from the allMarketOwners array

params.index: The index of the owner to retrieve

returns._0: Address of the market owner at the specified index

getMarketOwnersCount().details: Returns the length of the allMarketOwners array

returns._0: Total number of unique market owners

getOwnerBaseAssets(address).details: Retrieves the list of base asset addresses for a given market owner

params.marketOwner: Address of the market owner to query

getOwnerMarkets(address).details: Retrieves all market configurations for a given market owner

params.marketOwner: Address of the market owner to query

returns._0: Array of Market structs for all markets owned by the specified address

getRoleAdmin(bytes32).details: Returns the admin role that controls `role`. See {grantRole} and {revokeRole}. To change a role's admin, use {_setRoleAdmin}.

getTotalMarketsCount().details: Returns the length of the allMarkets array

grantRole(bytes32,address).details: Grants `role` to `account`. If `account` had not been already granted `role`, emits a {RoleGranted} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role. May emit a {RoleGranted} event.

initialize(address,address,address,addre.custom:error-cases: - ZeroAddress: When any required address parameter is zero
initialize(address,address,address,addre.custom:requirements: - All address parameters must be non-zero   - Function can only be called once during deployment
initialize(address,address,address,addre.custom:state-changes: - Initializes AccessControl and UUPS upgradeable functionality   - Grants DEFAULT_ADMIN_ROLE to the timelock address   - Sets all protocol address state variables
initialize(address,address,address,addre.details: Sets up the factory with all required contract addresses and grants admin role to timelock.      This function can only be called once due to the initializer modifier.

params._ecosystem: Address of the ecosystem contract for rewards
params._govToken: Address of the protocol governance token
params._multisig: Address of the Proof of Reserves feed implementation
params._timelock: Address of the timelock contract that will have admin privileges

isBaseAssetAllowed(address).details: Verifies whether the specified base asset is in the allowlist.      Market owners can only create markets for assets that are in the allowlist.

params.baseAsset: Address of the base asset to check

returns._0: True if the base asset is in the allowlist, false otherwise

isMarketActive(address,address).details: Returns the active status flag from the market configuration.      Markets can be deactivated for maintenance or emergency purposes.

params.baseAsset: Address of the base asset to check

returns._0: bool True if the market is active, false if inactive or non-existent

proxiableUUID().details: Implementation of the ERC-1822 {proxiableUUID} function. This returns the storage slot used by the implementation. It is used to validate the implementation's compatibility when performing an upgrade. IMPORTANT: A proxy pointing at a proxiable contract should not be considered proxiable itself, because this risks bricking a proxy that upgrades to it, by delegating to itself until out of gas. Thus it is critical that this function revert if invoked through a proxy. This is guaranteed by the `notDelegated` modifier.

removeAllowedBaseAsset(address).custom:emits: BaseAssetRemoved event with the asset address and admin
removeAllowedBaseAsset(address).custom:error-cases: - ZeroAddress: When baseAsset is the zero address
removeAllowedBaseAsset(address).custom:requirements: - Caller must have DEFAULT_ADMIN_ROLE   - baseAsset must be a valid address (non-zero)   - baseAsset must currently be in the allowlist
removeAllowedBaseAsset(address).custom:state-changes: - Removes baseAsset from the allowedBaseAssets EnumerableSet
removeAllowedBaseAsset(address).details: Prevents the specified base asset from being used for creating new markets.      Existing markets with this base asset will continue to operate normally.

params.baseAsset: Address of the base asset to remove from the allowlist

renounceRole(bytes32,address).details: Revokes `role` from the calling account. Roles are often managed via {grantRole} and {revokeRole}: this function's purpose is to provide a mechanism for accounts to lose their privileges if they are compromised (such as when a trusted device is misplaced). If the calling account had been revoked `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must be `callerConfirmation`. May emit a {RoleRevoked} event.

revokeRole(bytes32,address).details: Revokes `role` from `account`. If `account` had been granted `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role. May emit a {RoleRevoked} event.

scheduleUpgrade(address).details: Only callable by addresses with LendefiConstants.UPGRADER_ROLE

params.newImplementation: Address of the new implementation contract
